candidates.title: feat: split `ya send` into `ya pub` and `ya pub-static` to make it more ergonomic
feat: preserve files' modified at timestamp while copying
candidates.body:
Closes #863 

I couldn't find how to do this without a dependency, but if you like I could try copy how it's done in `filetime` (think it uses unsafe code though), or if you can think of another way that it can be done, do let me know.

feat: generate autocomplete script for `ya` command
feat: add a new `ya send` command to allow standalone client processes to communicate with DDS from the command line
candidates.body:
An implementation of the feature request: https://github.com/sxyazi/yazi/issues/891

Closes https://github.com/sxyazi/yazi/issues/891

---

I'll add the `ya send` command documentation to https://yazi-rs.github.io in the next few days.

candidates.title: perf: switch to `globset` to reduce CPU time spent on matching icons
candidates.body:
Before:

![1](https://github.com/sxyazi/yazi/assets/17523360/5b0eec69-a05c-499c-9bca-dda01f7a88bb)

After:

![2](https://github.com/sxyazi/yazi/assets/17523360/42ec256d-e2a2-48ba-bdb3-1bc6bfac1e60)

Reduced CPU usage by ~10% when matching icons

candidates.title: feat: add loading state to directories
feat: add `YAZI_ID` environment variable
feat: add new `move`, `trash`, and `delete` event kinds to DDS
candidates.body:
Previously, only the rename command sent `rename` events. Now a cut and paste operation also sends events.

Demo:


https://github.com/sxyazi/yazi/assets/300791/31711f7f-dc5f-4977-a8d8-07bed123702b

candidates.title: perf: re-implement file watcher in an async way
candidates.body:
The file watcher of Yazi uses [notify-rs/notify](https://github.com/notify-rs/notify), which involves some synchronous I/O operations when watching and unwatching to directories, such as checking if the directory exists and normalizing the directory path. 

This could cause lag when switching directories, especially when the user is using a slow device (such as an external HDD). This PR addresses this issue.

candidates.title: feat: add `is_exec` and `is_sticky` to `Cha` bindings
feat: detect CSI u through `Stderr` to allow using `Stdout` as the carrier of DDS payload without an ANSI sequence response timeout
feat: DDS (Data Distribution Service)
candidates.body:
This PR aims to address:

- Closes https://github.com/sxyazi/yazi/issues/766
- Closes https://github.com/sxyazi/yazi/issues/639

By introducing a new DDS (Data Distribution Service), allows communication and data synchronization between multiple Yazi instances through the plugin system.

It also provides a new mechanism to report Yazi events in real-time to external programs (such as Neovim) via `stdout`.

It's somewhat akin to a client-server architecture for `lf` but doesn't require running an additional server process and it's a Lua-based publish-subscribe pattern.

## TODO

- [x] Windows support
- [x] Plugin system API
- [x] State persistence
- [ ] Multi-tab and `tabs` event - will be implemented in subsequent PRs

I will add plugin API documentation to https://yazi-rs.github.io in the next few days.

candidates.body:
An implementation of the feature request: https://github.com/sxyazi/yazi/issues/319 - @Brixy

Closes https://github.com/sxyazi/yazi/issues/319

If you want to enable this feature, please use the latest default configuration file. For users who are using the old configuration file, the original behavior will remain unchanged to avoid confusion.
